result.execSummary:
The defendant Blaine B Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (>200-1000g), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)2.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 1:57pm [mo]
Reserve Judge Robert Mawdsley presiding for Branch IV
Defendant Blaine B Johnson in court with Attorney Michael C. Witt.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
  
Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " Guilty " entered on Count #1 without On/Near School Enhancer, without PTAC Enhancer; factual basis stipulated; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #2.

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
Statement made by Mr. Johnson

On Count #1, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 2 years, with conditions:

--to serve 60 days in the Jefferson County Jail, with work-release privileges, to commence on  12/31 /15 at 6:00pm.
---Mr.Johnson is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of work-release privileges without further process.

--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent
--to undergo assessment, treatment or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--random drug and/or alcohol screening
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--no possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--no possession or ingestion of alcohol
--no presence in bars, taverns, or liquor stores
--no contact with any drug offenders except for Tasha Grosskopf, Britney Kolodzne, members of the Defendant's immediate family, incidental contact at work and for treatment purposes per Agent
--to provide DNA sample upon demand
--to pay costs of $268 plus the $250 DNA surcharge
--to pay drug testing fees in the amount of $125--joint and several Tasha Grosskopf


Days credit for time already served:  1  days
recess: 2:13

Case called at 10:18am 
Defendant Blaine B Johnson in court with attorney Michael C. Witt.   ADA Monica Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty. Witt indicates that an offer has been extended by the State, requests additional time to discuss with Mr. Johnson, likely will resolve at next date.

The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling
ADA Hall expresses bond modification in co-Defendant's case, allowing contact between co-defendants. 
The Court removes the Bond Condition not allowing contact with Tasha Grosskopf and other conditions remain the same
recess:10:22am

NEXT: Status Conference on 12/11/15 at 1:30pm

Case called at 1:26 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant Blaine B Johnson in court with Attorney Michael C. Witt. DA Susan Victoria Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Service of Information admitted; reading waived; maximum penalties recited.
Defendant Stands Mute; Plea of "not guilty" entered on Defendant's behalf
Atty Witt requests matter be set for a DA PTC & STC, presents basis
DA Happ: No objection to proposed scheduling
Court reminds Defendant that bond and conditions of bond remain in effect as case is pending.
Recess: 1:27 pm 

NEXT: (1) DA PTC scheduled for 10/14/15 at 10:00 am - Send notices (2) STC scheduled for 10/29/15 at 10:00 am- Send notices

Case called at 11:10am
Reserve Judge Sarah O'Brien presiding for Branch IV
Defendant Blaine B Johnson in court with Attorney Michael C. Witt.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Mr.Johnson waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

ADA Hall submits Information.
Atty. Witt requests an Arraignment at a later date, requests it be scheduled with the Co-Defendant's Preliminary Hearing


NEXT:   Arraignment on 9/24/15 at 1:30pm (scheduled with Co-Defendant's Preliminary Hearing)
State Public Defender Determination of Financial Eligibility - Defendant not eligible.

ADDRESS INFO for Blaine B Johnson
Current: 503 Highland Ave, Fort Atkinson, WI 53538 United States  (Effective: 07-02-2015)
Prior: 449 E Racine St Apt 4, Jefferson, WI 53549
Scheduling Notice; Your Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case

Case called at 1:20 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant Blaine B Johnson appears via video, in-custody, from the Jefferson Count Jail, with Attorney Sylvie Dahnert (for SPD). Public Service Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court finds the proceedings are sight and sound sufficient

Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given.
Atty Dahnert informs the Court that Mr. Johnson does not qualify for SPD Services; so they appear for bond purposes only
Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; maximum penalties recited - DOB & address confirmed accurate
Preliminary Hearing time limits waived upon agreement of parties 

Court requires a $10,000 signature bond, with conditions:
-No possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription 
-No possession of drug paraphernalia without valid prescription
-No contact with co-defendant, Tasha Grosskopf
(*Direct or indirect contact prohibitions include but are not limited to phone calls, letters, emails, texts, social media, other electronic means and no one can contact the person on your behalf except an attorney.) 
--If Defendant needs to move belongings from shared residence, must be done by July 8th; in the presence of law enforcement
Recess: 1:26 pm

NEXT: (1) DA Pre-trial Conference scheduled for 7/29/15 at 11:40 am - Send notices (2) STC scheduled for at 8/21/15 at 11:00 am - Send notices
